Steps to tidy the dataset
=========================

1. Merges the training and the test sets to create one data set
---------------------------------------------------------------
```{r
# read the column names (used for both train and test raw data)
column_names <- read.table(file.path(getwd(), "UCI HAR Dataset","features.txt"), col.names=c("index", "column_name"))

# read the test data sets
subject1  <- read.table(file.path(getwd(), "UCI HAR Dataset", "test" , "subject_test.txt"), col.names=c("Subject"))
data1 <- read.table(file.path(getwd(), "UCI HAR Dataset", "test" , "X_test.txt"))
activity1 <- read.table(file.path(getwd(), "UCI HAR Dataset", "test" , "Y_test.txt"), col.names=c("Activity"))
# add column names to data1
colnames(data1) <- column_names[,2]
# column merge test data
test_data <- cbind(subject1,activity1,data1)

# read train data sets
subject2 <- read.table(file.path(getwd(), "UCI HAR Dataset", "train" , "subject_train.txt"), col.names=c("Subject"))
data2 <- read.table(file.path(getwd(), "UCI HAR Dataset", "train" , "X_train.txt"))
activity2 <- read.table(file.path(getwd(), "UCI HAR Dataset", "train" , "Y_train.txt"), col.names=c("Activity"))
# add column names to data2
colnames(data2) <- column_names[,2]
# column merge train data
train_data <- cbind(subject2,activity2,data2)

# row merge the final data frame
data <- rbind(test_data, train_data)
}```

2. Extracts only the measurements on the mean and standard deviation for each measurement
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
```{r
# filter for column names coainting 'mean()' or 'std()'
activity_ok <- grepl('mean\\(\\)|std\\(\\)',column_names[,2])

# add first to columns(Subject,Activity) to boolean vector
column_filter <- append (c(TRUE,TRUE), activity_ok)

# filter the columns
filtered_data <- data[column_filter]
}

4. Appropriately labels the data set with descriptive activity names
--------------------------------------------------------------------
```{r
# read activity names
activity_names<-read.table(file.path(getwd(), "UCI HAR Dataset","activity_labels.txt"),sep=" ",col.names=c("activityLabel","Activity"))

# map the activity code to an Activity_Name (cast because R is too smart, will use factor)
filtered_data$Activity = as.character(activity_names[filtered_data$Activity,2])

# write to file
write.table(filtered_data,file="tidy_dataset.txt")
}
